com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector

Class CameraDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector.Detector
      • com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector.CameraDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CameraHelper.OnCameraHelperEventListener

    public class CameraDetector
extends Detector
implements CameraHelper.OnCameraHelperEventListener
    A Detector for processing a stream of frames received from the device's camera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CameraDetector.CameraEventListener
      Reports events related to the handling of the Android Camera by CameraDetector.
      static class  CameraDetector.CameraType
      This enumeration is used to specify which camera to use during recording.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraDetector

        public CameraDetector(android.content.Context context,
              CameraDetector.CameraType cameraType,
              android.view.SurfaceView cameraPreviewView,
              int maxNumFaces,
              Detector.FaceDetectorMode faceDetectorMode)
        Creates a CameraDetector.

        This object should be created in the onCreate() method of its host Activity or Fragment

        Note: using the specified SurfaceView is much more efficient than using the returned frames in the Detector.ImageListener.onImageResults(List, Frame, float) callback to display camera images.

        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        cameraType - an enumerated value indicating which camera (front or back) to use
        cameraPreviewView -

        a SurfaceView to use as a camera preview. Note that the camera will stretch its images to fit the entire SurfaceView, so it is the responsibility of the developer to size the SurfaceView to have the same aspect ratio as the returned camera images. The OnCameraEventListener interface reports the selected camera frame size. See the Affectiva SDK Developer Guide for an example of how to correct the aspect ratio of the SurfaceView

        .

        As of SDK 2.0, it is no longer possible to submit a null value for the SurfaceView. The Android API requires a Surface for its camera to function. See the Affectiva SDK Developer Guide for an example of how to occlude the SurfaceView if you do not want it to be shown on screen.

        Please do not register for the SurfaceHolder.Callback interface belonging to this SurfaceView, as that interface is managed by the SDK.

        maxNumFaces - The maximum number of faces that the system should try to track. This may slow down the system.
        faceDetectorMode - A flag to specify if the system is tracking large (up close) or small (farther away) faces. Possible values are Detector.FaceDetectorMode.LARGE_FACES or Detector.FaceDetectorMode.SMALL_FACES.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context or cameraPreviewView is null.

      • CameraDetector

        public CameraDetector(android.content.Context context,
              CameraDetector.CameraType cameraType,
              android.view.SurfaceView cameraPreviewView)
        Creates a CameraDetector.

        This object should be created in the onCreate() method of its host Activity or Fragment

        Note: defaults the system to tracking a single large face, please use the other constructor if this is not your desired behavior. Note: using the specified SurfaceView is much more efficient than using the returned frames in the Detector.ImageListener.onImageResults(List, Frame, float) callback to display camera images.

        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        cameraType - an enumerated value indicating which camera (front or back) to use
        cameraPreviewView -

        a SurfaceView to use as a camera preview. Note that the camera will stretch its images to fit the entire SurfaceView, so it is the responsibility of the developer to size the SurfaceView to have the same aspect ratio as the returned camera images. The OnCameraEventListener interface reports the selected camera frame size. See the Affectiva SDK Developer Guide for an example of how to correct the aspect ratio of the SurfaceView

        .

        As of SDK 2.0, it is no longer possible to submit a null value for the SurfaceView. The Android API requires a Surface for its camera to function. See the Affectiva SDK Developer Guide for an example of how to occlude the SurfaceView if you do not want it to be shown on screen.

        Please do not register for the SurfaceHolder.Callback interface belonging to this SurfaceView, as that interface is managed by the SDK.

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context or cameraPreviewView is null.

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxProcessRate

        public void setMaxProcessRate(float maxFramesPerSecond)
        The maximum processing rate to operate in [FPS]. This will take effect after the next call to start().

        Default: 5 frames per second.

        Parameters:
        maxFramesPerSecond - the maximum frames per second the SDK can process frames, larger than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxFramesPerSecond is negative.

      • setSendUnprocessedFrames

        public void setSendUnprocessedFrames(boolean sendUnprocessedFrameFlag)
        When the SDK is in control of the camera, if the SDK frame rate is lower than the camera frame rate, there will be frames that are not processed for expressions by the SDK.
        Parameters:
        sendUnprocessedFrameFlag - Set this to true to receive unprocessed video frames.

      • start

        public void start()
        Initiates processing of frames received from the device's camera.

        Note: this method acquires exclusive access to the device's camera; other apps will not be able to use the camera until stop() is called.

        Overrides:
        start in class Detector
        Throws:
        LicenseException - if no or invalid license was provided see: Detector.setLicensePath(String).
        AffdexException - if the detector did not initialize successfully.
        IllegalStateException - if the Camera can not be opened.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops processing frames received from the device's camera, and releases the camera to allow its use by other apps.
        Overrides:
        stop in class Detector
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called before Detector.start().
        See Also:
        Detector.getPercentFaceDetected()

      • setCameraType

        public void setCameraType(CameraDetector.CameraType type)
        Indicates which device camera to use. This method will restart the camera if the Detector is already running. Thus, there is no need stop and start the Detector to switch between cameras.

        an enumerated value indicating which camera (front or back) to use

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Detector
        Resets the baselines used to measure facial expressions and emotions. Can be called at any time, but will not have any effect before calling Detector.start().
        Overrides:
        reset in class Detector

        public void setOnCameraEventListener(CameraDetector.CameraEventListener listener)
